positive.review:
I thought I'd like the challenge of bringing a smaller club up through the english divisions. 
Each season is the same though. meticulously set up the tactics, put in place the best staff and then season starts, have a run of 6 to 8 games unbeaten first up. Then all of a sudden your side cannot score, they cannot pass and go from being near the top to the middle of the pack or lower and then you are in danger of being sacked. Does not matter which team I pick or what players I transfer in. 
I have played almost 1400 hours and it is so frustrating to play it. On the bright side if you want to lose yourself for hours then this is the perfect game for you.
One of the best FM in recent years.
The best football management sim you will find :)

Hours played: 450+

Football Manager 2023 is not just a game — it’s a lifestyle. Every save feels like a new story, full of drama, heartbreak, and triumph. The depth of tactics, scouting, and player development is unmatched, and I often find myself losing track of time as I plan the next big signing or tweak my formation to perfection.

What makes FM23 so special is the emotional attachment it creates. Winning the Champions League after years of building a squad feels like a real achievement. Even the tough moments, like losing a wonderkid to a bigger club, add to the immersion and realism.

Yes, the learning curve is steep, but once you get into it, it becomes incredibly rewarding. For football fans who love strategy and long-term planning, FM23 is an absolute must-have.
I hadn't played a football manager since the 2003-04 version, but I did enjoy this one. There are a bit too many menus, but after a while you get used to it.

I thought I'd like the challenge of bringing a smaller club up through the english divisions. 
Each season is the same though. meticulously set up the tactics, put in place the best staff and then season starts, have a run of 6 to 8 games unbeaten first up. Then all of a sudden your side cannot score, they cannot pass and go from being near the top to the middle of the pack or lower and then you are in danger of being sacked. Does not matter which team I pick or what players I transfer in. 
I have played almost 1400 hours and it is so frustrating to play it. On the bright side if you want to lose yourself for hours then this is the perfect game for you.
The graphics & the attention to detail is very impressive.
Perfect representation of football in a game.
Great game, just like every FM is very addicting
It's amazing. I can't describe how awesome it is so you have to check it out yourself.
epic as is the whole of football manager.
just too addictive, its like an itch that has to be itched
One of the best FM in recent years.
only way to save man utd is to set every player at 100
The best football management sim you will find :)
would recommend to people who dont have a habit for breaking keyboards.
Icl great game (even better then EAFC)

negative.review: Disappointing experience. The interface feels cluttered, matches are extremely random, and the AI makes illogical decisions way too often. There are barely any real improvements — it feels more like a paid database update than a new game. Frequent bugs and strange player behavior on the pitch ruin it even more. Not recommended

Such a frustrating game. It should be enjoyable....like older revisions in the CM series. the constant inbox is insufferable. The players are always moaning about one thing or another. Its almost impossible to sell players for reasonable value. i just want to pick a team, build a tactic, win some games and find my wonderkids. And i want to get through a season in a few sittings. The new FM series are far too much. it takes about 3 hours to get beyond pre-season alone. Go back to the simpler version if you want enjoymment. if its pain and misery you're after, get FM23
SI is a scammer company. Please Steam remove them from your platform.
